data.text: @EU_Commission @MichelBarnier There’s never been a better time to be a proud European citizen.
@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier I think you will also share some of the blame for a weaker EU without the UK Michel
@EU_Commission This great. For example, could this be an option for #nationalservice @EmmanuelMacron ?

@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier Absolument  si les  britanniques ne peuvent pas ou ne veulent pas trouver une solution au problème créé par leurs mythes de grandeur la frontière sera dans la mer...sinon le RU deviendra le Zimbabwe de l'Europe. Voilà choisissez
@EU_Commission wrote a quick report today on the positive effects of immigration from the A8 and the problems of restricting this for the UK and its negative consequences..

@EU_Commission please can you publish an explanation about the Junker Selmayr mess? I need to know that it is not as it seems, if not lawfully corrupt, then morally. Explain the promises made to the people who could stand in the way of the secretary general appointment?
@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier Guru Barnier leading the Grand Mass. The worst dogmatism is to be found in Brussels.
@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier 'Our values, our identity, our Single Market...'. I mean, if a Single Market is your 'identity'...

@EU_Commission Good indication that one of 4 pillars is getting stronger. The proposed authority could speed up the completion of the single market, at least on the face of it. The proposed ELA is also in the interest of young people who tend to be most mobile, no? @Laura__EU
@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier We aren't sacrificing the future we are building it by saying goodbye to the present .......
@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier Oh Micho, après tout tu n'es qu'un joli visage!

@EU_Commission @VDombrovskis @mariannethyssen @EU_Social @ChristianWigand I’ve lived and worked in Germany, France, Spain and the UK. Thanks to this. Best experience of my life. Recently left UK after 13 yrs and back to Spain. Starting new. In the EU. Speak 5 languages. I feel truly European.

@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier “Never sacrifice the future for the present”. Just out of interest, how do you guys square that statement with the fact that you have saddled the next generation with an insurmountable mountain of debt?

@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier Across the canal leavers are moaning about bullying. How can insisting on keeping and protecting the integrity of the fundamental rules holding together 27 nations in any way be seen as bullying? And why would 27 nations change the rules because one nation rejects them?
@EU_Commission Allow sovereign governments to show preferential treatment to natives on benefits then you wankers.

@EU_Commission @VDombrovskis @mariannethyssen @EU_Social @ChristianWigand my sister recently received a conditional admission in Erasmus program (EUROPE) but she needs funding for her research. Would you help me in this regard. Do you know any funding agencies? If you want I can send the official documents of hers.

@EU_Commission @MichelBarnier my sister recently received a conditional admission in Erasmus program (EUROPE) but she needs funding for her research. Would you help me in this regard. Do you know any funding agencies? If you want I can send the official documents of hers.

@EU_Commission @mariannethyssen The EU is not social and the most of the people from Holland does not like the EU.

In light of this I am convinced this undertaking should be of a very high priority.

@EU_Commission It was due to the so called "freedom of movement" that I voted to leave the EU and I have no regrets at doing so.
@EU_Commission @MartinSelmayr No everybody agrees with that. There have been no exhaustive studies of the full impact on indigenous populations.  Cherished by the elites, but hated by many.

@EU_Commission ,

@EU_Commission @JunckerEU @MichelBarnier "...European future – not on the past, and not on Brexit.” What Juncker said is OK (Im sure he said it). Now the idiot Brits want us to think of them. Their 'infallible' Queen! Kate, William, George...  First they shud IMPROVE ON SPOKEN ENGLISH!
@EU_Commission @JunckerEU @MichelBarnier That Farage, what a yob! He won’t be missed one bit, counting the days..

@EU_Commission @JunckerEU @MichelBarnier It is a pity but Brexit will change life for people living in the island of Ireland. Building walls between us is coming but to the past but it is sadly what UK vote and tories are responsible of all this mess.
@EU_Commission @JunckerEU @MichelBarnier It would be awesome if they put the feed in different languages.
@EU_Commission @JunckerEU @MichelBarnier @JunckerEU rudely interrupted by some fat (presumably British) oaf

Good!!!

And #censorship is the tool of petty tyrants, not open and honest government
@EU_Commission @VDombrovskis @vanessamock @EU_Finance Well done, just in time to coincide with brexit in march 2019. Funny how brexit has kicked your arses in to gear. It's been a Big wake up call.
@EU_Commission @DSMeu @EU_Growth @NatBruxelles @LuciaCaudet I for one welcome our new overlords behind the curtain.

@EU_Commission Questo non è solo la Catalogna, il governo della Spagna usa la repressione e la violenza ogni volta che la gente esce a difendere i propri diritti. Questo è VIOLAZIONE dei diritti fondamentali e il vostro silenzio vi rende complici #stoprepressione #shameonyou

@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya @DSMeu Due to the real participation ... « 83% of the europeans » means in reality « 0,0...% » of the near 450 Millions europeans. It is not better than any fakenews, it sounds like propaganda. PS: Do you really want Democratie ?

@EU_Commission Our fanatic and populistic government have rule of law for nothing they think that they are the law, it's dangerous. They want to take judges by force for themselves. Please keep us save and democracy.
@EU_Commission Lower Austria already proud owner of the prize for #carnuntum
@EU_Commission EU PR #BrexitReality #BrexitMeansBrexit

@EU_Commission Many of us want to Leave so that we do not need to comply with EU rules.
Once out we could 
remove VAT on sanitary products
stop long haul transport of live animals 
without being in breach of EU rules
@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya @DSMeu 99% of Europeans think there are way too many Euro politicans and staff, earning way too much, throwing way too much money, to achieve way too little results.
@EU_Commission Option: delegate to member states is missing! This is a fake poll! Any conclusion that xx% supports one of these options is invalid!

@EU_Commission @czorrinho @GabrielMariya a lot (maybe most) of disinformation comes from official channels with a political agenda, so what do you mean exactly, the disinformation or just the one that comes from the "other" side, whatever it is at the current time?
@EU_Commission #Selmayr @JunckerEU @eucopresident you’re a bunch of criminals stealing from the people. Fascist bastards , crooks
@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya There are a number of blockchain company using a consensus blockchain to tackle this issue. I would be interested to hear if you are looking into these?
@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya So transparency is important? Then why is there no transpare3ncy on the claim by EU twitter account that 83% of EU population supports action against fake news?

@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya "online platforms should, for instance, ensure transparency by explaining how algorithms select the news put forward."
So if I want to criticize EU on disinformation in a blogpost, because one of your tweets catches my eye, I first got to make an algorithm????

@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya @DSMeu I took part in the public consultation and am pleased to see actions taking place. Proud to live in the EU where the #fakenews phenomenon is being taken seriously. #TackleFakeNews
@EU_Commission What a great anger with me.
@EU_Commission and @Europarl_EN must ensure that the EU continue to be a safe place for journalism ! #JanKuciak  #DaphneCaruanaGalizia #JournoSafe #EndImpunity

@EU_Commission @GabrielMariya @DSMeu It all depends of what you call disinformation, unfortunately. For example, the disaster of Fukushima. We finally knew what really happened thanks to the voluntary watchdogs, just because the mainstream press didn't write anything about it.
So what? Solve the educational problem

@EU_Commission Option - 3 -⚙ full EU border management system (14%)  is more sensible but on condition that the EU, somewhere, reduces costs, reduce bureaucracy because 14% with the budget for border protection should come with financial savings.  Good luck from Poland❤️🇪🇺

@EU_Commission @GOettingerEU @Avramopoulos @EUHomeAffairs Border budget should be based on border states being primarily responsible for controls in their own territory, using central EU resources to augment, but not replace, their own units & infrastructure. Individual states know their own borders best
@EU_Commission Keep up the great work! 🇪🇺😀👍☘️

@EU_Commission @GOettingerEU @Avramopoulos @EUHomeAffairs Alors sans hésiter  l'option 3. C'est de l'investissement à long terme et loin voir bien que la situation d'aujourd'hui nous coûte bien plus chère.
@EU_Commission I would like to opt for the most humane option. But which one is that? What are the anticipated results and in which direction would the money go alternatively?
@EU_Commission Before how much, explain what for...
@EU_Commission 4. Get back the power to the people
@EU_Commission What about using that money to create a solid infrastructure to receive and help refugees instead?
@EU_Commission Loaded choice. Pity.

The European Border and Coast Guard represents 0.4% of total #EUbudget 
Several options are on the table to develop it beyond 2020:
📈 exploit it to the maximum (0.8%)
👮‍‍ step up operational capacity (1.8-2.3%)
⚙ full EU border management system (14%)

What would you opt for?
